t: Hosea 4
Hear*p the word of the Lord,*s ye children of Israel: for the Lord*s hath a controversy with the inhabitants of the land, because there is no truth, nor mercy, nor knowledge of God in the land.
By*p swearing, and lying, and killing, and stealing, and committing adultery, they break out, and blood toucheth blood.
Therefore*p shall the land mourn, and every one that dwelleth therein shall languish, with the beasts of the field, and with the fowls of heaven; yea, the fishes of the sea also shall be taken away.
Yet*p let no man strive, nor reprove another: for thy people are as they that strive with the priest.
Therefore*p shalt thou fall in the day, and the prophet also shall fall with thee in the night, and I will destroy thy mother.

My*p people are destroyed for lack of knowledge: because thou hast rejected knowledge, I will also reject thee, that thou shalt be no priest to me: seeing thou hast forgotten the law of thy God, I will also forget thy children.
As*p they were increased, so they sinned against me: therefore will I change their glory into shame.
They*p eat up the sin of my people, and they set their heart on their iniquity.
And*p there shall be, like people, like priest: and I will punish them for their ways, and reward them their doings.
For*p they shall eat, and not have enough: they shall commit whoredom, and shall not increase: because they have left off to take heed to the Lord.*s
Whoredom*p and wine and new wine take away the heart.
My*p people ask counsel at their stocks, and their staff declareth unto them: for the spirit of whoredoms hath caused them to err, and they have gone a whoring from under their God.

They*p sacrifice upon the tops of the mountains, and burn incense upon the hills, under oaks and poplars and elms, because the shadow thereof is good: therefore your daughters shall commit whoredom, and your spouses shall commit adultery.

I*p will not punish your daughters when they commit whoredom, nor your spouses when they commit adultery: for themselves are separated with whores, and they sacrifice with harlots: therefore the people that doth not understand shall fall.
Though*p thou, Israel, play the harlot, yet let not Judah offend; and come not ye unto Gilgal, neither go ye up to Bethâ€“aven, nor swear, The Lord*s liveth.
For*p Israel slideth back as a backsliding heifer: now the Lord*s will feed them as a lamb in a large place.
Ephraim*p is joined to idols: let him alone.
Their*p drink is sour: they have committed whoredom continually: her rulers with shame do love, Give ye.
The*p wind hath bound her up in her wings, and they shall be ashamed because of their sacrifices.
